page.name: Extended Learning Opportunity: Suggested Alternatives to Unit 1 Video
page.content:
If you do not teach ESL learners and would prefer viewing videos of other classes, we recommend that you select an alternative video, from one of the following options:

  • Teaching Channel
    Website: https://www.teachingchannel.org/videos?default=1
    The Teaching Channel features K–12 oriented videos that are professionally made. These include many related to English language arts and math, and so may be comparable, in some cases, to topics and skills addressed in ABE instruction. You need to create a free account to access these videos, but anyone may do so.Especially relevant are the following:
    • One video is titled "Collaboration vs. Cooperative Learning" and runs 3 minutes.

    • A math video titled "Conjecturing about Functions" runs just over 9 minutes.

  • Media Library of Teaching Skills (MLoTS)
    Website: http://www.mlots.org
    MLoTS is a free, digital collection of short, authentic classroom videos intended for adult basic education professional development. The videos are on YouTube and can be viewed on the MLoTs site, which also provides supportive text materials (e.g., downloadable standards-based lesson plans and discussion questions). You do not need to create an account to view these videos. Some of the videos featured have been made by adult educators themselves.Especially recommended are the following videos:

    • One video that is particularly relevant to this course is titled "Numeracy: Positive and Negative Numbers" and runs 14.5 minutes.

    • Another video relevant to this course is titled "ESL/ESOL: Food vocabulary and verb tenses" and runs 9.5 minutes.

  • You may instead prefer to videotape yourself teaching a class or arrange to observe or videotape a colleague's class. For help, see the tips listed in Harnessing Technology.
